module.p: strì struggle, strive, battle, compete is an intransitive (durative) atelic verb, with verbal noun strì fem.

Examples from Gairm –
Bha grunnan de ar luchd-leughaidh an dùil, nuair a nochd an àireamh mu dheireadh de Ghairm, gu robh sin a’ strì ri buidheann shònraichte, no duine sònraichte, a chur do ’n Phàrlamaid, agus bha wèireichean an telefon gu math teth, uair no dhà, an déidh dhuinn tighinn o ’n chlò. Thog iad ceàrr sinn. [...]
Some of our readers were expecting [?], when the last issue of Gairm appeared, that that was striving to send a particular group [party?], or a particular person, to the Parliament, and the telephone wires were pretty hot, for an hour or two [once or twice?], after we came from the printers. They misunderstood us. [...] td. 9, ‘Air an Spiris’
